content:
Ciao, di solito se una mail è presente nei risultati di ricerca ma poi non si apre, significa che la mail è stata cancellato ma l'indice di Thunderbird non si è ancora allineato. Questo capita soprattutto quando l'archivio di posta è molto grande.

Esiste un metodo per rigenerare da zero tutto l'indice ed è illustrato qui https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale Se decidi di applicarlo però fai prima un backup del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

Le mail archiviate invece vengono semplicemente spostate in un'altra cartella. A seconde delle impostazioni che hai scelto, l'archiviazione avviene in cartelle divise per anno o per anno e mese. Qui trovi la spiegazione dettagliata su come funziona -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/archiviazione-messaggi
creator: @next

Password generale non mi dice nulla. In Thunderbird esiste una Password principale che può essere impostata dall'utente e viene chiesta ogni volta che si lancia il programma -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/password-principale-thunderbird

Nella stessa guida è spiegato come reimpostare una password principale dimenticata o persa. Attenzione al fatto che se procedi con questa operazione verranno persi tutti i nomi utente e le password memorizzate. E dovrai quindi reinserire manualmente queste informazioni prima di poter nuovamente scaricare o avviare la posta.

content:
Basic info on creating a link:

In Write window, with focus in the content typing area Ctrl+K keys will open the 'Link Properties' window which you can also access via 'Insert' > 'Link' .

You type whatever text you want to act as the visible link. Then you have to add the actual link to whatever webpage you desire. So if you had previously 'Copied' that link and it was still in the memory you could use 'Ctrl+V' to paste in the link into the 'Link location' text box.

click on 'OK' to actually add that link into the Write content area position where the text cursor is located.


I'm trying to find out if there was some preference settings which used to do what you mention, but I cannot say I've ever noticed it in the past.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: The issue is that the email provider's email server needs security updates. This has nothing to do with POP or IMAP. These messages need to be shared with the email provider to have corrected. They will know what has to be done because the DKIM and SPF issues mentioned in messages are known concerns. This is happening because many email hosts (such as Gmail) are now putting more stringent security controls in place. Again, there is nothing to do in Thunderbird or the account; this is a problem that must be fixed on the server.
creator: davidsk

content: As an aside, I suggest she increase security of her account and use encrypted password. That is a separate issue from the problem being reported. It's just safer.
creator: davidsk

content:
If it cannot compact due to a lack of space, this implies you may be trying to compact all folders or maybe you are not compacting as frequently as you should or you are not creating enough folders to store an dorganise emails - too many emails stored in a single document.

Start by compacting a single folder and see how it goes. Suggest you compact the folders that get the most activity, but that I mean which fodlers get the most emails moved or deleted. Those folders typically are 'Drafts, Junk and Inbox.

Start with Drafts, then Junk/Spam to see if this creates more space.

  • Right click on Drafts folder and select 'compact'.
  • Right click on Junk/Spam folder and select 'Empty Junk'
  • Right click on Junk/Spam folder and select 'compact'
  • Move emails out of 'Inbox' and put them into suitably named folders for storage and organisation.
  • Right click on 'Inbox' folder and select 'compact'.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hello there We have read the message We try to help you.


https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-accessibility-features

The settings are also incorporated in your Thunderbird menu bar.. In the Thunderbird bar go to tools and options and then to advanced. Click on the configuration editor option at the bottom right.

There will be a checkbox for accept risk. accept this.

type pixelsp in the input field.

layout.css.devPixelsPerPx will appear in front of you and here you can enter a value, try 1.5 . Do you have a preference for setting Window text?

You can adjust this via: Settings, Accessibility, Screen and Make text larger. You can use the slider to determine the desired size of the font.

You can also use a good add_onn for these topics.

Greetings firefox volunteer

content: Address autocomplete scans all address books, including Collected Addresses, where the old contact probably remains.
creator: sfhowes

content: Yes, that was the problem apparently. I don't understand the purpose of "Collected Addresses". I have lists in my "Personal Address Book", which are also in "Collected Addresses", and I also have lists in "David's Contacts". The lists that are in "David's Contacts" do not show up in "Collected Addresses". I don't understand how all that works or why it is that way. It looks like I need to make all my lists under "David's Contacts" if I don't want them to show up in "Collected Addresses".
creator: dbculp63

content:
The purpose of Collected Addresses is to store recipients' addresses that you don't need in Personal Address Book, but keep them available for autocomplete if you send to them again. It can be disabled in Settings.

You should keep mailing lists in Personal or other user-defined address books, and the fact they are also in Collected won't affect autocomplete - unless you make edits and don't delete obsolete versions from Collected.
creator: sfhowes

content:
The lower panel where you see email content is called the 'Message Pane' and it displays opened emails. In the past some people have called it a preview pane becuase they believed it was not a proper opened email until opened in a tab, but it's not a preview and those people were very much mistaken.

Have you got setting to auto mark as read upon opening?

  • 'Settings' > 'General'
  • scroll to 'Reading & Display'
  • select 'Automatically mark messages as read'
  • Select 'immediately on display'

Assuming you use IMAP so please advise if you use pop. Do you have to settings auto download full copies or headers?

  • 'Account Settings' > 'Synchonisation & Storage'
  • Message Synchronising
  • select 'keep messages in all folders for this account on this computer'
  • Click on 'Advanced'...
  • check - are all folders and subfodlers selected for full download'

Note: any folders that are not selected will only download headers.

Is this selected: 'Synchronise all messages locally regardless of age'

Do you have any Anti-virus program set up to scan files when opened etc ? Advise is to access Anti-Virus and set up the thunderbird profile folder as exempt from scanning.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Thanks for your reply. I am using POP. ANd I leave mail on the server (GMail).

This problem is relatively new; TBird has normally marked my messages as read within 1 second of viewing in the Message pane. I first noticed this problem happening on a few e-mails maybe 2 months ago but it seems to becoming more common. At first, I though that it was just a case of e-mails using bold tags in the subject line so that it *looked* unread. But once I opened the Error Console, I could see it throwing errors each time I moved the selection from each of these messages. The weird thing is that there are at least 6 different errors in the console and the specific error seems to change from time to time. Previously, it was the Identities[0] error that was most prevalent but currently it's

  • Uncaught (in promise) InternalError: too much recursion 
   getCardBookDisplayNameFromEmail Chrome://cardbook/content/formatEmailCorrespondents/ovl_formatEmailCorrespondents.js:45    formatDisplayName

Another common problem was:

  • [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x80070057 (NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE)
  • downloadable font: failed to start download (font-family: "BMWTypeNextLight" style:normal weight:300 stretch:100 src index:0): content blocked

Given this is a relatively new installation of TBird 115.0.1, I'm really surprised how many errors it's throwing behind the scenes. (I've never opened the console in the past so I have no data on how many were thrown in the past.)

creator: ferrerslocke

content:
Whatever you have selected in the formatting bar eg: Fixed width When you start to type it applies fixed width But then you want to paste some text copied from anywhere, but that copied text will have formatting already applied, so it pastes 'as is' which means 'Variable width' will get used.

So if you do not want to include any formatting that has ben 'copied' you need to use:

  • 'Edit' > 'Paste with formatting' or use shortcut keys: 'Ctrl+Shift+V'

But if you always send in plain text, then why are using HTML to write the email ?

  • In 'Account Settings' > 'Composition & Addressing' for the account
  • uncheck 'Compose messages in HTML format'

then all your email will get composed automatically in plain text and any formatting is auto stripped.

Note : Having swapped over to plain text by default and should you still want to create the occasional HTML email then press 'Shift' whilst you click on 'Write' to get a single use HTML email.
creator: Toad-Hall

I have the same problem: Ctrl-V sets variable width.

Interestingly, a SECOND Ctrl-V then inserts the copied content.

Actually, this happens only at the end of a mail being composed, i.e., AFTER all formatted text regions, but Ctrl-V or the Paste command works fine (without setting variable width) when I use it between existing text.

So, if I paste at the end of a newly composed mail, it does NOT work (sets variable width), but if I paste within existing text, it works (and preserves formatting of the copied content).

Before the upgrade to Supernova, I never experienced such issues.

OK - I could use Ctrl-Shift-V - but the standard behavior would be much appreciated !

I could also start composing my mails with some final lines (like blank line plus a period) and then start writing at the top and later insert via Ctrl-V (before my extra final lines) - but this sounds nasty ...

creator: Wlodzislaw1

content:
re : Ctrl-V or the Paste command works fine (without setting variable width) when I use it between existing text.

Yes because you have already set the formatting in that area, so it's using it. Formatting gets extended as you type, so it's not already added to areas you have not actually typed in.

As with anything you paste - it will contain formatting from where ever you copied it from, so if appending to email then you either accept the formatting that came with the paste or you use Ctrl-Shift-V and that is the standard.

Try this. At the end of the text click on Return/Enter key a couple of times to create new empty lines and then use arrow key to go back up a line - then use Ctrl V to paste.

content:
when we go back as far as V52 there were hard coded locations in some of the settings, so upgrades to new locations (based usually on a new user name) can cause issues.

In this case I suggest you close Thunderbird and delete the foldertree.json file which is a cache of the entire folder pane and see if the folders appear after the application restarts.

content:
Are you viewing emails in plain text ? Check you are using Original HTML. View > Message Body as > 'Original HTML'

To create an image;

  • Get email displaying and then press the 'Prt Scr' key on keyboard to put on clipboard.
  • Open a simple image program like 'Paint'
  • Use 'Ctrl+V' to paste image into 'Paint'.
  • Edit as required.File > Save as ' select jpeg image
  • Give file a suitable name
  • choose where to save it eg: desktop

In this forum question - use the 'Add images' 'Browse' button to locate that jpg image on desktop click on 'Open' It gets uploaded and displays as a thumbnail image.

content:
re :If you are creating them using HTML - not sure what you mean by this.

When you are composing an email you can compose using HTML or Plain Text. If you click on 'Write' and you can see the 'Formatting Bar' then it is auto set up to use HTML. If you click on Write and there is no Formatting Bar and it cannot be enabled then you are writing in Plain Text so it's not possible to use any formatting. In 'Write' window: View > Toolbars > Formatting Bar

To set up HTML or switch it off - set up here for each mail account:

  • Account Settings > Composition & Addressing (for mail account)
  • Select checkbox : 'Compose messages in HTML format' to enable formatting.

content:
Top of Message List - Column headers - where you see 'threads,Starred, attachments, from, subject, etc

Problem sounds like you do not have the 'Date' column enabled but do have the 'Order Received' column header enabled.

  • Right click on column headers and select 'Date'.
  • Right click on column headers and select 'Order Received' to uncheck it.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Once you have the 'Date' column header visible again.... Clicking on the 'Date' column header will reverse the order of display. So you can sort by newest at top or newest at bottom.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re :looking for an email that I received on 2/27/2023

Via 'Menu Bar' toolbar

  • 'Edit' > 'Find' > 'Search Messages'
  • OR use 'Ctrl+Shift+F' keys
  • Search for messages: select the mail account name - not a folder.
  • Select checkbox 'Search subfolders'
  • Select 'Match all of the following'
  • Select 'Date' and 'is' and '2/27/2023'
  • click on 'Search' button

If the email exists then that should find it. the 'location' column header will say which folder it is in.
creator: Toad-Hall

Even then I don't like supernova, far to many things are simply not there or incomplete.unless serious customization is undertaken is is now the only way to access the address book calendar etc.

The idea that the user should have control of the menu location has been raised in the feedback forum. You might like to add your vote. There appear to only be four of us so far that think having it in the middle is a rather poor choice. https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/allow-the-user-to-place-the-menu-bar-at-the-top-of-the-window/idc-p/38004#M22023
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I never used Space in TB in 102 either I have no need for them and to put the Action menu at the top of the application goes against all Windows UI design. I had to turn off the File | View menu bar entirely to bring the action menu closer to the email messages that they are acting on.

I added my feedback to that thread as well. This update also broke several of my extensions for Thunderbird which were working fine at 102. So darn frustrating that this release was made available to people without several cautions regarding it. I use TB daily and do not need to relearn processes all over again
creator: pcguy

Post images that show settings for these:

  • 'Fonts For: Latin'
  • 'Fonts for : 'Other Writing Systems'
  • and any other ' Fonts for'language setting you may use.

content:
You have x-western = latin minimum size set as much larger than you have set for all other settings which is overriding everything. You have only set up one 'Other Writing system', so that is incomplete and is probably using default.

You have :

  • font.minimum-size.x-western = 16 but your minimium over rules your medium setting a much larger by default.
  • font.size.variable.x-western = 12 - your 'medium' setting has been set as the lowest size
  • font.size.fixed.x-western = 14
  • font.size.monospace.x-western = 16

You need these settings

  • font.minimum-size.x-western = 12 or 10 (This setting needs to be less than or equal to the others which all need to be the same)
  • font.size.variable.x-western = 14 or 12 (what ever you set here must be set in the others below)
  • font.size.fixed.x-western = 14 or 12
  • font.size.monospace.x-western = 14 or 12

This can be done via two methods: Either:

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll down to 'Language & Appearance' section
  • click on 'Advanced'
  • Select: 'Fonts For: Latin'
  • Set all the 'size' requirements to 12
  • Select 'Fonts for : 'Other Writing Systems'
  • Set all the 'size' requirements to 14 or 12
  • reselect 'Fonts For: Latin'
  • click on 'OK'

See image showing my settings - I have used size 14 for all except minimum which I use 12.

OR: via Config Editor - see image below as guide

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll down to the bottom
  • Click on 'Config Editor' button

It opens in a new tab

  • In the top search type: font.minimum - see image below as guide
  • scroll down until you locate these two settings:
  • - font.minimum-size.x-unicode
  • - font.minimum-size.x-western

Do the following for both settings

  • click on 'pencil' icon to get edit mode
  • clear all contents
  • type in required size - I suggest 12 or 10

This forces any small size to not show smaller than this setting.

  • click on 'tick' icon to save setting.

Now to alter other font sizes using same process. In top search type: font.size.variable Scroll to locate:

  • - font.size.variable.x-unicode
  • - font.size.variable.x-western

Do the following for both settings

  • click on 'pencil' icon to get edit mode
  • clear all contents
  • type in required size - I suggest 14 or 12

This sets what is known as 'medium'

  • click on 'tick' icon to save setting.

In top search type: font.size.fixed Scroll to locate:

  • - font.size.fixed.x-unicode
  • - font.size.fixed.x-western

Do the following for both settings

  • click on 'pencil' icon to get edit mode
  • clear all contents
  • type in required size - set same size as you previously set for 'variable'
  • click on 'tick' icon to save setting.

In top search type: font.size.monospace Scroll to locate:

  • - font.size.monospace.x-unicode
  • - font.size.monospace.x-western

Do the following for both settings

  • click on 'pencil' icon to get edit mode
  • clear all contents
  • type in required size - set same size as you previously set for 'variable'
  • click on 'tick' icon to save setting.

To see images below in much larger size - in forum click on thumbnail image below to enlarge.
creator: Toad-Hall
